channel.title: Tools on Thoughts
channel.description: Recent content in Tools on Thoughts

item.title: Asset appraisal
item.description: Consider What we want to know in evaluation of investments. What has happened over the past two years? What has been purchased? Why were the assets purchased, purchased? How have they been doing? Why were they purchased that way? How do you make the purchases happen? What are the plans for the future? Why have these plans? What do you see for the future? How do we know for sure?

item.title: Remap factor levels
item.description: Further to data extract of human muscle group from Wikipedia the goal here was to remap the factor levels in the variable source. The intention is to shrink down the number of categories from 48 to 5 to simplify understanding of statistics to be performed on muscle groups in future. To achieve that the source variable in the data frame was converted to factor type. It was then duplicated.

item.title: Column add and reorder
item.description: Task: Extract table data from Wikipedia; Combine table rows into one data frame; Add a column to combined data frame that provides name of original dataframe - so as to facilitate identifying source of data Reorder the columns in expanded data frame to put orgin data frame column first. There are 48 tables of muscle groups in the human body listed on the wikipedia page. Each table was extracted and stored in a separate data frame.

item.title: Company results template: share price
item.description: Purpose Thought process and actions steps following on earnings announcement. The example am using is the fourth quarter results posted by Suzuki Motors (7269.T, JPY3700) for period ended 2020-03-31. Recent price performance Recent price analysis versus benchmarks show the shares of Suzuki remain 26% below the peak in the year and below that of the Nikkei and Dow Jones. ## `summarise()` regrouping output by 'symbol' (override with `.groups` argument) ## # A tibble: 3 x 6 ## # Groups: symbol [3] ## symbol company curr_price min_price max_price pctchange_from_max ## <fct> <fct> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 ^N225 N225 Index 22864.

item.title: India states and territories
item.description: Project This project aimed to use R to extract India state and territory names from a wikipedia page.
